From Apple‚Äôs Dictionary.app:

**mer¬∑ce¬∑nar¬∑y** | Ààm…ôrs…ôÀånerƒì | **adjective** (of a person or their behavior) primarily concerned with making money at the expense of ethics: _she's nothing but a mercenary little gold digger._ An odd example as if it was written by an angry misogynistic guy or something. I‚Äôm just saying... hehe

There‚Äôs many words that could use a little tweaking to make their meaning a little more clear or at least, a little more descriptive in terms of the reality they describe. Adding or deleting a single character (as in ‚Äòhealthscare‚Äô) or changing a syllable slightly (as in ‚Äòpolitricks‚Äô) brings us closer to a word‚Äôs true meaning.
I think ‚Äúthe future of awesome‚Äù really means ‚Äúnot quite awesome yet.‚Äù üòé
An odd example as if it was written by an angry misogynistic guy or something. I‚Äôm just saying...

I‚Äôm convinced the thought that fills my mind most of the time is just a complex of [reactions](reactions.md) to the strange world I‚Äôm living in. Creative [urges](urges-1.md) struggle to redirect my mind to what I don‚Äôt see, to what might be. I want to deal with what‚Äôs possible, not wallow is what‚Äôs already taken place and left its ugly mark.
Be inquisitive. Know what you don't know.
Click on a post in the sidebar to view it. Click on a paragraph to view related ideas.

We lived above the sub shop. My parents had opened one of area‚Äôs first, specializing in [Italian subs](sub.md), Philly steak sandwiches, Sicilian pizza, and other goodies. It‚Äôs not surprising I was a fat little kid back then.

To be honest, I‚Äôm not sure if it was the Delaware Bay or the Chesapeake Bay but Tony and my father had these huge cages for catching crabs and we‚Äôd return [home](above%20the%20sub%20shop.md) with bushels of ‚Äôem.
and I know how to make one!
When we discovered Sliding Rock, we had not bathed for days camping up in the mountains. The cold plunge pool below was totally rejuvenating.

The web has changed but there remain remnants of what it once was in terms of personal sites. I track some of those remnants, curating such sites (which are still active, or when I‚Äôm lucky, new), hoping to somehow keep my original vision of the web intact. It‚Äôs a tough road to drive on but I‚Äôve got a decent set of wheels with a few bells and whistles and more important, I enjoy the driving.
(of a person or their behavior) primarily concerned with making money at the expense of ethics: _she's nothing but a mercenary little gold digger._

She told us there were liberals living next door as if we would think that was bad thing. ‚ÄúThey didn't like the sign in our yard.‚Äù Funny how easy it is to be so full of yourself that you think others would have to agree with you. You're on the right side of history after all. How could anyone not agree?
Then again, one's own experience or perspective might come into play here - I know - I‚Äôm kinda silly...
